Plock's Park Adventure

A1

ES: Owen y Plock son amigos. Plock es un robot divertido. Hoy van al parque.

EN: Owen and Plock are friends. Plock is a fun robot. Today they go to the park.

ES: Owen quiere aprender español. Plock es su maestro especial. Plock dice: "¡Vamos, Owen!"

EN: Owen wants to learn Spanish. Plock is his special teacher. Plock says: "Let's go, Owen!"

ES: Ellos ven un árbol grande. "Mira, Owen, es un árbol verde", dice Plock. Owen mira el árbol.

EN: They see a big tree. "Look, Owen, it is a green tree," says Plock. Owen looks at the tree.

ES: Después, ven una flor bonita. "¡Es una flor roja!" dice Owen. "¡Muy bien!" dice Plock con una sonrisa.

EN: Afterwards, they see a pretty flower. "It is a red flower!" says Owen. "Very good!" says Plock with a smile.

ES: Hay tres pájaros pequeños. Los pájaros son azules. "Uno, dos, tres pájaros azules", cuenta Plock. Owen repite.

EN: There are three small birds. The birds are blue. "One, two, three blue birds," counts Plock. Owen repeats.

ES: Owen corre y salta en el parque. Plock lo mira. "¡Qué divertido!" dice Plock. El parque es genial.

EN: Owen runs and jumps in the park. Plock watches him. "How fun!" says Plock. The park is great.

ES: Owen está muy feliz. Plock también está feliz. Aprender español es una aventura con un amigo robot.

EN: Owen is very happy. Plock is also happy. Learning Spanish is an adventure with a robot friend.

Vocabulary

amigo - friend
robot - robot
parque - park
aprender - to learn
mira - look (command)
árbol - tree
flor - flower
roja - red (feminine)
azul - blue
pájaros - birds
corre - runs (he/she/it)
feliz - happy

Grammar Note

This story uses the verb "ser" (to be) to describe permanent characteristics, like "Plock es un robot" (Plock is a robot). It also shows adjective agreement, meaning adjectives change to match the noun's gender and number. For example, "árbol verde" (green tree - masculine singular) but "flor roja" (red flower - feminine singular) and "pájaros azules" (blue birds - plural).
